website_summaries.verdict: The Magellan Cyclo 505 is a great bike companion whether you're looking to get a workout or navigate a new city.
pros: Surprise mode helps you find new routes

customer_reviews.title: Magellan Cyclo 505 does not support Linux Operating Systems.
customer_reviews.text: At home I only have Linux operating systems installed on my computers. There seems to be an universal prejudice against open source, GNU General Public License software. The Magellan Cyclo 505 does not support Linux. I must rely on family and friends who use use Window products to connect to Magellan for registration of product, and firmware & map updates Other than this minor annoyance, the device appears to be a reliable GPS device, good for cycling about in unfamiliar areas. The affordable price is a big selling point.
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: I wanted this device to work
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this cycling GPS computer to work as advertised. I really like the size, the operation and color touch screen, but the touch screen was sluggish at times and I could never get the speed and cadence sensors to work. I even tried using my Garmin Ant+ speed and cadence sensors with no luck. I could have lived with the touch screen issue, but the sensors not working meant this unit had to be returned. I was even willing to live with having to charge the unit daily due the battery not lasting a full day.
customer_reviews.author: K. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Great Product! Not sure why so many have issues ...
customer_reviews.text: Great Product! Not sure why so many have issues getting everything installed and talking. Took 20mins to install on 29er Felt Virtue some really nice features and all the basic work flawless. Really happy with the purchase will see how it holds up in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and easy to install at a fraction ...
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and easy to install at a fraction of the Garmin price. Your dashboard screen is customizable showing only the info you want. Battery lasts quite sometime but I have not yet did a century with it yet. Downloading it to a pc is easy as well. I cannot say how it links with STRAVA since I do not use it.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Reitz

customer_reviews.title: An amazing little biking computer
customer_reviews.text: An amazing little biking computer. I love it. I am finding it hard to find a sensor to pair with it, but that is my fault and not the fault of the computer.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Unca_T Marty

customer_reviews.title: the navigation features are useless. For bike traking is ok
customer_reviews.text: The unit and the features are OK; however, in the documentation, specs, etc, there is not clarification that this unit is only for use in USA, I mean, It doesn't allow to load new country maps. So If you buy it and use it in other county, the navigation features are useless. For bike traking is ok; but the map obviously is not showed.
customer_reviews.author: Omar Becerra

customer_reviews.title: Still not quite a garmin alternative for me.
customer_reviews.text: I like the mapping functions, and the user interface seems more intuitive than Garmin's. However, I was never able to get the wifi to connect to my open network, the battery life was not good enough for century rides, and it just felt too big and bulky for my tastes. Sent it back before I'd used it enough to know if it's any less glitchy than garmin.
customer_reviews.author: ab

customer_reviews.title: The touch screen freezes rendering the unit useless. I guess you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I should have heeded the warnings of others regarding the Magellan 505. After initial charging, the computer would open only after several tries. The touch screen freezes rendering the unit useless. I guess you get what you pay for. Will get a Garmin.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Working fine
customer_reviews.text: Good product. The cadence and speed sensor went wrong, but Magellan send me another new one and it's working perfect. The worst part is that the preloaded maps are only available for US. There's no way to add new maps of other countries. The app for mobile would be better
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great features ,yet slow
customer_reviews.text: Great screen and full features, yet very slow and slow to response. if you like to navigate between screens you should look for a different device
customer_reviews.author: Nir Galpaz

customer_reviews.title: Affordable option to more expensive GPS systems.
customer_reviews.text: Are use this product for road biking. Has worked great for my use.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Lee

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very nice device. It does what it says and it transfers the data to strava.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bike computer arrived quickly.
customer_reviews.text: Use this devise to record my cycling ride which are the major fitness activity I use to maintain my fitness and provide me with some chill-out time.
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: The app for the device is not available for Apple Phone. Therefore, not enjoying the total benefit
customer_reviews.author: James H. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great features but not durable at all. Better for road biking not MTB'ing
customer_reviews.text: The screen broke in a crash (not even a gnarly crash) in the first month and the device stopped working. They replaced the whole uni for $60 which is policy. Customer service was great. Why 2 stars? The screen broke again in another crash (again a slow easy fall over crash) in the next month and the device stopped working. I've owned 2 garmins the first one I lost, the second one has endured so many more gnarly crashes and never has a screen cracked yet or the device broken. I loved the features of the Magellan but it's just not tough enough for MTB'ing. Maybe for road riding only but don't "expect" it to survive a crash.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: I love the
customer_reviews.text: Is accurate with in itself and the magelland webpage.its algorithm with popular fitness pages or apps is not so hot. I love the three random route feature. Really like everything about it except the fact that its intergration with most popular apps is lacking.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce V Doty Jr

customer_reviews.title: Great Cycling Computer
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why so many negative reviews for this computer. This is my first cycling computer and it's awesome it does everything that was built for and more.Love the 3"inch full color display, the easy connectivity with my WiFi also sync to Strava, Heart rate monitor - Easy setup and never fails, Text notifications in-display and Music, Surprise me" feature, and many features more. The set up was a breeze less than 10 min. I download the MioShare software it's more updated than Magellan and they have support for my 505hc. My friend have a Garmin 510 and as soon he saw mine he love it. I highly recommend this cycling computer to any one by far.
customer_reviews.author: JE

customer_reviews.title: Nice GPS
customer_reviews.text: Nice GPS. Had a Garmin for many years and Garmin no longer supports the one I have. It stopped working and I am liking this Magellan 505. It seems to work better for storing your data with Bluetooth as opposed to direct USB connection. Screen could be a little brighter at times. There may be a way of increasing but I havhaven't had it long enough to find it. Mounting brackets come with it. It is sometimes a little difficult to snap it into the bracket(s) but once it is snapped in, it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Walston

customer_reviews.title: Magellan 505 HC
customer_reviews.text: After losing my Garmin Edge 25 I was looking for something bigger that might be easier to see if it fell of my bike or out of my pocket. THe bigger Garmins were just out of my budget. So far I am very happy with this. lots of functions and easy to set up. Really like the bigger screen. Lasted about 17 hours on and all day ride so that was impressive to me as the Edge was lucky to do 5 hours. Only con is the software features don't seem as robust as Garmin's but I can live with the difference as I can edit it after I import it into Strava.
customer_reviews.author: Ole Man Winter

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good GPS, especially for the price. Setup wasn't as easy and straightforward as I would have liked but I was finally able to get everything working. It tracks my rides and quickly uploads to strava as long as there is a fast wifi available. On a recent bike trip I wasn't able to sync with Strava for several days because the hotel and restaurants didn't have good enough wifi. My buddy was able to instantly upload his ride from his Garmin using data on his phone. Pros: price, color touchscreen display, surprise me feature, control music via Bluetooth Cons: difficult to setup, needs wifi to upload rides Verdict: good GPS for recreational riders (especially for the price).
customer_reviews.author: cory powers

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality Control
customer_reviews.text: I should have read Jim’s review of 2/12/18 before this purchase. What a disappointment this unit is! It freezes on the loading screen, if you turn it on and off about 8 times it gets past the load (maybe) and freezes on the touch screen menu making it about as useful as the plastic overlay that came with it. I had finally decided to go GPS after using a very basic SIGMA for years and was quite excited to get going with it. DISAPPOINTMENT! Make sure these things work before they get out of the factory!!! It’s a zero star product.
customer_reviews.author: Hutch

customer_reviews.title: Never Again
customer_reviews.text: I have had this unit for 14months and it will not longer hold a charge. Contacted customer service and they said they can not do anything because its out of warranty (less than 2months) but they did offer the give me 30% discount on another unit REALLY!!! spend $300 and it only lasted about yr and they think I would buy another one of their products! I don't think so. My suggestion would be to buy a Garmin or Wahoo.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Cyclo he 505
customer_reviews.text: Good. First one returned. Cannot get lap top to recognize it. Called customer service, no help, no updates . Unit works well, calorie count is way off from other unit used simultaneously . Called about that, same response .
customer_reviews.author: Frank Sims

customer_reviews.title: Hey great GPS it works really well only wish that it ...
customer_reviews.text: Hey great GPS it works really well only wish that it had a temperature outside temperature reading so you could tell what the temperature was when you were riding .?
customer_reviews.author: Edward Sawyer

customer_reviews.title: No cadence feature
customer_reviews.text: Exceptional product with the exception of the cadence I was unable to sink it to the GPS.....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is a great device - doing all perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I was using the 105 for a year, and upgraded to this in a price of 120$.... It is a great device - doing all perfectly! I synchronizes on Wifi and on my MAC and all is working perfect. Do not hesitate to buy - great cycling computer!
customer_reviews.author: Ran

customer_reviews.title: This is much better at navigation than similar Garmin units
customer_reviews.text: This is much better at navigation than similar Garmin units, though the "training" features (which I don't use) aren't as good. There have been multiple firmware updates already fixing little issues. While some still remain they have been much more proactive with fixes than Garmin ever was.
customer_reviews.author: Top362nd

customer_reviews.title: No quality control
customer_reviews.text: One thing I really hate is to get a product that malfunctions directly from the factory. I charged my new unit overnight and then followed the rest of the manufacturer's setup instructions. The unit froze repeatedly and I was never even able to complete the setup. Magellan product support recommended that I exchange it for another unit but rather than risk getting another lemon, I have opted for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Warthog

customer_reviews.title: Awful Unit - Worst Customer Service Ever
customer_reviews.text: Could not get this to work right. I had either cadence or speed but never both. Magellan customer service was as bad as anything I've ever experienced. Their website shut me out before their posted quit time. The phone guys were not at all helpful. The email responses were perfunctory recitations of the user manual and seemed to simply ignore my specific issues. Nice menu colors but that's about the only thing I can say positive about it. Sent it back - got the Garmin. Works fine. Their customer service actually responded in a timely manner with a helpful solution that answered my question.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Drobny

customer_reviews.title: Had to return this item
customer_reviews.text: It looks good. The description of its capabilities and included map was amazingly tempting. However, it turned on only after a few tries and the cadence/speed sensor is too bulky to be installed on my bike. So didnt even got out on the road.
customer_reviews.author: Paulitico

customer_reviews.title: ... so I don't know yet how my son will like it.
customer_reviews.text: It is a Christmas present so I don't know yet how my son will like it.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty Sipes

product_meta.title: Magellan 505 HC GPS Cyclo Computer
product_meta.description: Magellan's Cyclo 505 and 505hc are powerful cycling GPS computers designed for the serious cyclist. Both models come with vibrant 3" color screen that is easily read in direct sunlight, rugged and water resistant to IPX-7 standards, include cable tie and Out-front mounts and have a simple interface with large buttons for gloved hands. The Cyclo 505 models are the first cycling GPS computers to provide Bluetooth Smart connectivity. Most riders will have their phone tucked away when riding and with the Magellan Cyclo 505 and 505hc you can pair with iPhone and select Android devices and receive text message and call notification alerts directly onto the Cyclo device. If a rider uses a Bluetooth headset (sold separately) they could answer an incoming call or set up an automatic response to let the caller know you are on a ride and will call back. Cyclo's Bluetooth support also allows you to control your music playlists directly from the device. Not feeling the current song, use your Cyclo device to skip it or change playlists. No computer, no problem. The Cyclo 505 and 505hc provide wireless connectivity so uploading your tracks has never been simpler. Whether you're at a local hot spot or in the comforts of home Cyclo can transfer your data to the Magellancyclo.com website. Use Strava to save and share your tracks? Simply set Magellancyclo.com to immediately upload your tracks to Strava whenever you save to the website. One push of a button and you're done; more wireless app compatibility is on the way so stay tuned. Cyclo 505 models are compatible with Shimano's Di2 electronic road bicycle shifting systems with the Di2 Wireless Unit (SM-EWW01) featuring the new Shimano D-Fly Data Management system. Read and record shifting information from compatible Di2 electronic shifting units. Information can be displayed in either gear position, gear number or visually by a chart or graph. Battery status and alerts or warnings are also visible.High-sensitivity SiRFstarIII GPS - 3-5 meter GPS accuracy provides a superior and accurate navigation experience for wherever your ride may take you.Rechargeable Lithium Battery - Up to 12 Hours of battery life with a rechargeable Lithium Ion cell battery. Go strong for an entire day.
feature_bullets: 3" color transflective screen Vibrant touchscreen providing direct sunlight readability.
Rugged design Cyclo 505 and 505hc can take any sort of terrain you can. Built to IPX-7 standards the Cyclo 505 models can be submersed in 1 meter of water for 30 minutes.
Detailed Road & Open Street Map Preloaded maps showing cycle lanes, cycle tracks and bike shop POIs. Discover new cycle routes and bike trails or record and share your own.
Complete USA road network and OSM crowd source trail data showing cycling POIs like bicycle shops
Bluetooth Smart connectivity for smartphones and sensors including over 130 ANT+ speed, cadence, heart rate and power accessories
User Friendly/ No heavy layers/ Intuitive user interface/ Largest touch screen in cycling GPS computer category at 3"
Preloaded with: Tele Atlas road network and Open Street Map bike network
Connects your iPhone or Android phone to Cyclo allowing you to view who is calling and read an SMS message

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.4 out of 5 stars85 ratings3.4 out of 5 stars
